slide.notes: In this PowerPoint, I have utilized rule-example and scaffolding.

slide.text: All About Angles!
Obtuse Angles The Basics of Angles Reflex Angles Acute Angles Right Angles 2. 1. 5. 4. 3. Move through the topics at your own pace

slide.title: Right Angles
slide.text: Right Angles A right angle is a “square corner”. A right angle is 90°. A right angle looks like this:

slide.title: More About Right Angles!
slide.text: More About Right Angles! Only right angles have a square at the vertex. Right angles can be rotated many ways. But as long as there is a square corner, the angle is a right angle.

slide.title: Let’s Take a Quiz!
slide.text: Let’s Take a Quiz! Is this a right angle? Yes No

Awesome!!!
Let’s see how you do on the next question.

slide.title: Sorry…
slide.text: Sorry… Remember that right angles often have a square at the vertex. Let’s try again.
How about this angle? Is it a right angle? Yes No

slide.title: Great!!!
slide.text: Great!!! You really know your right angles!

slide.title: Sorry…
slide.text:
Sorry… Remember:
If an angle is not a “square corner”, it is not a right angle. Let’s try again.

slide.title: Let’s try one more question…
slide.text: Let’s try one more question… Fill in the blank: A right angle is _____ degrees. A. 90° B. 30° C. 120° B. 30° C. 120° B. 30° C. 120°

slide.title: Fantastic!!!
slide.text:
Fantastic!!! A right angle is always 90°.
Click here and choose a new area of angles to explore.

slide.title: That’s too bad
slide.text:
That’s too bad A right angle is always 90°.
Let’s try again.

slide.title: The Basics of Angles
slide.text:
The Basics of Angles An angle is formed when two lines or two line segments meet at a point. Here’s an angle formed by 2 rays:
Here’s an angle formed by 2 line segments:

slide.title: More Basics of Angles…
slide.text:
More Basics of Angles… This is the symbol for an angle:
Angles are measured in degrees.
For example, if an angle is 35 degrees, we write it like this: 35° Notice the symbol for degrees.

slide.title: And More Basics of Angles
slide.text:
And More Basics of Angles All angles have a vertex.
The vertex is like the “elbow” of the angle. I’m a vertex.

slide.title: How We Mark an Angle…
slide.text:
How We Mark an Angle… Sometimes we make a curve at the vertex to show measurement.
When the angle is a right angle, we often draw a square at the vertex.
45° 90°

slide.title: Very Important Info!!!
slide.text: Very Important Info!!! Even though we share the same vertex, I measure a different angle than that green arc over there. I measure a different angle than that red arc over there.

slide.title: Angles Are All Around Us
slide.text: Angles Are All Around Us Click here to learn about the types of angles.

slide.title: Acute Angles
slide.text: Acute Angles An acute angle is greater than 0° and less than 90°. An acute angle is “more closed” than a right angle. Right Angle “Square Corner” Acute Angle Acute Angle Acute Angle Acute Angle

slide.title: PacMan and the Acute Angle
slide.text:
PacMan and the Acute Angle This is Pac-Man.
Pac-Man’s mouth is an acute angle.
Acute angle
Isn’t Pac-Man cute?
Acute

slide.title: Let’s Take a Quiz!
slide.text: Let’s Take a Quiz! Can you pick the acute angle? A. B. C. D.

slide.title: Great!
slide.text: Great! You really know your acute angles!

slide.title: Sorry…
slide.text: Sorry… An acute angle is between 0° and 90°. An acute angle is “more closed” than a right angle.

slide.title: Let’s Try Another Question
slide.text:
Let’s Try Another Question True or False: An acute angle is less than 90°.
True False

slide.title: Sorry, Let’s Review Acute Angles
slide.text: Sorry, Let’s Review Acute Angles An acute angle is greater than 0° and less than 90°. An acute angle is “more closed” than a right angle. Right Angle “Square Corner” Acute Angle Acute Angle Acute Angle Acute Angle

slide.title: Excellent!
slide.text: Excellent! You’re getting good at this!

slide.title: One More Question…
slide.text:
One More Question… Which one of these is an acute angle?
1. 2. 3. 4.

slide.title: Great!
slide.text: Great! You really know your acute angles! Click here to check out other types of angles.

slide.title: Sorry…
slide.text: Sorry… An acute angle is between 0° and 90°. An acute angle is “more closed” than a right angle.

slide.title: Reflex Angles
slide.text:
Reflex Angles Reflex angles are between 180° and 360°. A 180° angle is a straight line.
A 360° angle is a completely closed angle.
Reflex angles are in between. 180° 360°

slide.title: Examples of Reflex Angles
slide.text: Examples of Reflex Angles 270° 260° 240° 210° 335°

slide.title: Let’s Check Your Reflexes!
slide.text:
Let’s Check Your Reflexes! Which one of these is an reflex angle?
1. 2. 3. 4. 45° 340° 90° 30°

slide.title: Wow!!!
slide.text:
Wow!!!
Great job! Now try one more.

slide.title: Sorry, Let’s Review Reflex Angles
slide.text:
Sorry, Let’s Review Reflex Angles Reflex angles are between 180° and 360°. A 180° angle is a straight line.
A 360° angle is a completely closed angle.
Reflex angles are in between.
180° 360°

slide.title: Examples of Reflex Angles
slide.text: Examples of Reflex Angles 270° 260° 240° 210° 335°

slide.title: Let’s See If You Know This One
slide.titleNormalized: let’s see if you know this one
slide.text: Let’s See If You Know This One A reflex angle is… A. Between 0° and 90°. D. Between 90° and 180°. B. Between 180° and 360°. C. Between 90° and 360°.

slide.title: Sorry, Let’s Review
slide.text:
Sorry, Let’s Review Reflex angles are between 180° and 360°. A 180° angle is a straight line.
A 360° angle is a completely closed angle.
Reflex angles are in between.
180° 360°

slide.title: Examples of Reflex Angles
slide.text: Examples of Reflex Angles 270° 260° 240° 210° 335°

slide.title: Great Job! One More Question
slide.text: Great Job! One More Question The two lines below form two angles. Which angle is the reflex angle? The Green One! The Orange One!

slide.title: Sorry, Let’s Review
slide.text:
Sorry, Let’s Review Reflex angles are between 180° and 360°. A 180° angle is a straight line.
A 360° angle is a completely closed angle.
Reflex angles are in between.
180° 360°

slide.title: Examples of Reflex Angles
slide.text: Examples of Reflex Angles 270° 260° 240° 210° 335°

slide.title: Stupendous!!!
slide.text:
Stupendous!!!
You really know about reflex angles .
Click below to return to the main menu.

slide.title: Obtuse Angles
slide.text:
Obtuse Angles An obtuse angle is open more than a right angle.
But an obtuse angle is more closed than a straight line.
An obtuse angle is between 90° and 180°.

slide.title: Angle Diagram
slide.text:
Angle Diagram This diagram shows the different types of angles from the starting point. Red shows acute angles. Green shows obtuse angles. Purple shows reflex angles. Yellow shows a right angle.
Acute Obtuse Reflex I’m a right angle. Starting Line Note: An angle’s starting line is different every time. We judge the angle on how many degrees it opens up.

slide.title: More About Obtuse Angles
slide.text:
More About Obtuse Angles Remember this diagram? The green area shows obtuse angles.
Acute Obtuse Reflex I’m still a right angle Starting Line Note: An angle’s starting line is different every time. We judge the angle on how many degrees it opens up.

slide.title: Let’s Take a Quiz!
slide.text: Let’s Take a Quiz! Can you pick the obtuse angle? A. B. C. D.

slide.title: Sorry, Let’s Review Obtuse Angles
slide.text:
Sorry, Let’s Review Obtuse Angles An obtuse angle is open more than a right angle.
But an obtuse angle is more closed than a straight line.
An obtuse angle is between 90° and 180°.

slide.title: Sorry 
slide.text: Sorry  This one was tricky. We know the angle is not obtuse for 2 reasons. The angle has a square at the vertex. The angle is a “square corner”. Both of these facts make it a right angle. Let’s try again.

slide.title: Great!
slide.text: Great! Let’s try another.

slide.title: An Obtuse Question
slide.text:
An Obtuse Question How many degrees are in a obtuse angle?
A. An obtuse angle is between 90 and 180 degrees. B. An obtuse angle is between 0 and 90 degrees. C. An obtuse angle is 90 degrees. D. An obtuse angle is between 180 and 360 degrees.

slide.title: Sorry, Let’s Review Obtuse Angles
slide.text:
Sorry, Let’s Review Obtuse Angles An obtuse angle is open more than a right angle.
But an obtuse angle is more closed than a straight line.
An obtuse angle is between 90° and 180°.

slide.title: Way to Go!
slide.text: Way to Go! Knowing how many degrees are in an obtuse angle is as important as knowing what it looks like.

slide.title: A Truly Obtuse Question
slide.text: A Truly Obtuse Question True or False: This angle is obtuse. True False

 I have some good news and some bad news. The Bad News: If you thought this was a reflex angle, you were wrong.
Pay attention to the measurement arc.
The Good News: If the measurement arc was on the other part of the angle, it would be a reflex angle.

slide.title: YES!
slide.text: YES! You still knew it was an obtuse angle even though it was rotated. You are a clever kid!

slide.title: The Project
slide.text: The Project Your mission is to create a collage. You will use a large piece of paper. Divide the paper into 4 sections like this: Right Obtuse Reflex Acute Label the four sections like this…

slide.title: Making the Angles Collage
slide.text: Making the Angles Collage Cut out pictures of the 4 types of angles. Draw in the vertex, measurement arc, and lines with a magic marker, crayon or paintbrush. Make it beautiful. We will post these in the hallway for the world to see! Click here for a small example.
Right Reflex Obtuse Acute
